result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Richards is heard, they're not ready to proceed. Waiting on treatment court in Lacrosse to accept him. 
State is heard and no opposed.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:16 AM Cases 22CF59 22CF69 & 22CF94 called together- appearances stated.

Atty. Erickson is heard on status of these cases - probably going to be resolved, requests Aug. status date

questions by defendant - requests to pick up notice of hearing rather than having them mailed, inquires when no contact order will be lifted
Court advises clerk will hold notices for him to pick up and  def. to speak to his attorney if he wishes to have bond modified. 

Court declines to modify bond at this time

1:31 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Limkin E.M.N. Kinani appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video audio for Limkin E.M.N. Kinani.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF94 - Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

22CF94 - Information was filed and brought over. 

22CF59 - Atty Erickson is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 
22CF69 - Atty Erickson is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
22CF94 - Atty Erickson is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.

22CF59 and 22CF69

Atty Erickson is heard. Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings.
Arraignment scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Referral letter for Treatment Court
Defendant not to possess/consume any alcohol; submit to PBTs if requested by L.E.; if positive or refuses PBT, must submit to a blood draw.

2:49 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Limkin E.M.N. Kinani appeared by video, in custody in the Crawford County Jail.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Limkin E.M.N. Kinani.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF59 & 22CF69

Court will cancel the bench warrant since defendant turned himself in. 
Atty Erickson is heard on case. 

State requests that bond be doubled for a total of $600.00 in one case and $1,000.00 in the other case.
Atty Erickson is heard and requests that bond remain the same. 

Court orders that $200.00 bond be added in each case. 
22CF59 increased $200.00 to total of $500.00
22CF69 increased $200.00 to total of $700.00
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:26 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Limkin E.M.N Kinani appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court finds probable cause.
     D.A. requests $500 cash bond, no alcohol, submit to PBTs with blood draw if PBT is refused or positive.  Notes other recent cases he is on bond for.
     Def. comments on bond; not working currently.
